com.pump.audio

Class WavPCMAudioInputStreamFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • javax.sound.sampled.AudioInputStream
        • com.pump.audio.FrameFilterAudioInputStream
          • com.pump.audio.WavPCMAudioInputStreamFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class WavPCMAudioInputStreamFilter
extends FrameFilterAudioInputStream
    This converts PCM audio to a wav-friendly AudioFormat. This filter can perform three conversions:
    • Convert big endian to little endian.
    • Convert signed 8-bit to unsigned 8-bit.
    • Convert unsigned 16-bit to signed 16-bit.

    It is technically possible for a wav file to have big-endian encoding if the header begins with "RIFX" instead of "RIFF", but this class assumes you want to write the traditional "RIFF" header.

    This class is not capable of converting non-PCM audio samples to a wav-friendly AudioFormat, though.

    • Method Detail

      • isWavCompatible

        public static boolean isWavCompatible(javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat format)
        Parameters:
        format -
        Returns:
        true if this AudioFormat is ready to be output to a wav audio file. This will return false if the format is big-endian, or if the sign doesn't match the sample size. In wav files: 16-bit audio is signed, and 8-bit audio is unsigned. So if this format represents 16-bit unsigned or 8-bit signed: then this method returns false.

      • getFormat

        public javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat getFormat()
        Overrides:
        getFormat in class javax.sound.sampled.AudioInputStream

      • filterFrames

        protected void filterFrames(byte[] data,
                            int off,
                            int frameCount)
        Description copied from class: FrameFilterAudioInputStream
        Filter several consecutive sample frames.
        Specified by:
        filterFrames in class FrameFilterAudioInputStream
        Parameters:
        data - the array storing the sample frames.
        off - the offset in this array the frames begin at.
        frameCount - the number of frames to filter. So the number of bytes filtered should equals (frameCount * this.frameSize).
